concepts.name: Sleep Quality
concepts.description: A metric indicating the restorative nature of sleep, measured through physiological parameters and self-assessment.

concepts.name: Cognitive Function
concepts.description: Mental processes including attention, memory, and decision-making, assessed as a key indicator of teacher performance.

concepts.name: IoT Technology
concepts.description: Networked devices enabling real-time data collection from wearables for health monitoring applications.

concepts.name: Teacher Well-Being
concepts.description: Overall health and psychological state of educators, influenced by sleep and cognitive factors.

concepts.name: Workload Impact
concepts.description: The negative effect of high job demands and multi-tasking on sleep and cognitive outcomes.

concepts.name: SpO2 Monitoring
concepts.description: Measurement of blood oxygen saturation levels using wearable sensors to assess sleep physiology.

concepts.name: Pulse Rate Monitoring
concepts.description: Tracking heart rate variability during sleep to infer sleep quality and physiological stress.

concepts.name: Cognitive Assessment Questionnaire
concepts.description: A standardized self-report tool for evaluating teachers' cognitive function and mental state.

concepts.name: High School Teachers
concepts.description: The target demographic studied, facing unique stressors affecting sleep and cognition.

concepts.name: Multi-Tasking Stress
concepts.description: Job-related pressure from handling multiple responsibilities, linked to impaired sleep and cognition.

methods.name: IoT Sensor Deployment
methods.description: Use of smartwatches with pulse and SpO2 sensors to collect physiological sleep data in real-world settings.

methods.name: Cognitive Assessment Questionnaire
methods.description: Self-administered psychological tool for quantifying cognitive function through structured questions.

methods.name: Cross-Sectional Survey
methods.description: Data collection from a large sample (208 teachers) at a single time point to assess current sleep and cognitive states.

methods.name: Correlation Analysis
methods.description: Statistical method to identify relationships between sleep quality categories and cognitive assessment scores.

methods.name: Sleep Quality Categorization
methods.description: Classification of sleep data into 'poor', 'fair', or 'good' based on sensor-derived metrics.
